definition: waist and back/fig. upright and still healthy
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Supporters of the peg now have their response.
sentences.chinese: 而现在，联系汇率制的支持者腰板可以挺起来了。

sentences.english: I could never sit Indian-style the way other kids did.
sentences.chinese: 我从来不能象其他孩子那样挺直腰板盘腿而坐。

sentences.english: The Monkey sat up, grave and dignified, on the Dolphin's back.
sentences.chinese: 挺直腰板坐在海豚背上的猴子摆出一副庄严的神态。

sentences.english: So keep standing, keep learning, and keep living.
sentences.chinese: 所以挺直腰板，继续学习，继续生活。

sentences.english: But he walked straighter , with more confidence, than the others.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他却比其他人更加自信，走路腰板更直。
她已经75岁了，腰板仍然笔直。

definition: head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
(standing) very straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright/well-ironed/trim
erhua variant of 身板[shen1 ban3]
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
arrogant appearance/smug appearance/to act condescending/to put on airs
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
